column2: Construct an ontology focused on the following: case. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```@prefix : <http://www.example.com/ontology#> .@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#> .:Case a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Case"@en ;    rdfs:comment "A generic concept for cases or instances in various domains." .:LegalCase a owl:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Case ;    rdfs:label "Legal case"@en ;    rdfs:comment "A legal case is a dispute between opposing parties resolved by a court, or by some equivalent legal process." .:MedicalCase a owl:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Case ;    rdfs:label "Medical case"@en ;    rdfs:comment "A medical case is the occurrence of one or more medical conditions or the provision of care for that condition in a patient." .:CaseIdentifier a owl:DatatypeProperty ;    rdfs:domain :Case ;    rdfs:range xsd:string ;    rdfs:label "Case identifier"@en ;    rdfs:comment "The unique identifier of a case." .:CaseDescription a owl:DatatypeProperty ;    rdfs:domain :Case ;    rdfs:range xsd:string ;    rdfs:label "Case description"@en ;    rdfs:comment "The description of a case." .:caseHasParty a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain :LegalCase ;    rdfs:range :Person ;    rdfs:label "has party"@en ;    rdfs:comment "An individual who is consented or involved in a legal case." .:caseHasCondition a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain :MedicalCase ;    rdfs:range :Disease ;    rdfs:label "has condition"@en ;    rdfs:comment "A medical condition or disease associated with a medical case." .```Please adapt and extend the ontology to your needs including adding the `Person` and `Disease` classes if needed. The `xmlns:xsd` prefix (used for the range of the DatatypeProperties) is often assumed to be known, and is <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>.
